resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on a change in pull request #3190: ARROW-4041: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3190#discussion_r241962205
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_python.sh
 ##########
 @@ -55,8 +52,12 @@ conda install -y -q \
       --file $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
       pip \
       numpy=1.13.1 \
+      python=${PYTHON_VERSION} \
 
 Review comment:
   I had thought that having `python` in `conda_env_python.yml` was a bit weird

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

kszucs commented on a change in pull request #3190: ARROW-4041: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3190#discussion_r241962250
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_python.sh
 ##########
 @@ -55,8 +52,12 @@ conda install -y -q \
       --file $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
       pip \
       numpy=1.13.1 \
+      python=${PYTHON_VERSION} \
 
 Review comment:
   That's actually a dependency of pyarrow :)
   We can remove it though, python's version is pinned explicitly.

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #3190: ARROW-4041: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3190#discussion_r242097346
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_python.sh
 ##########
 @@ -55,8 +52,12 @@ conda install -y -q \
       --file $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
       pip \
       numpy=1.13.1 \
+      python=${PYTHON_VERSION} \
 
 Review comment:
   The env file is for development and CI, right? It's not a conda recipe per se. I think it's better to remove Python from it, otherwise similar issues are bound to later happen.

----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #3190: ARROW-4041: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3190#discussion_r242097517
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_python.sh
 ##########
 @@ -44,19 +41,24 @@ conda activate $CONDA_ENV_DIR
 # python-test fails.
 export ZLIB_HOME=$CONDA_ENV_DIR
 
-python --version
-which python
-
 if [ $ARROW_TRAVIS_PYTHON_JVM == "1" ]; then
   CONDA_JVM_DEPS="jpype1"
 fi
 
-conda install -y -q \
+conda create -y -q -p $CONDA_ENV_DIR \
       --file $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
+      cmake \
+      curl \
 
 Review comment:
   I'm curious, isn't the system `curl` not enough? Or is not installed on Travis?

----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou closed pull request #3190: ARROW-4041: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3190
 
 
   

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/ci/conda_env_python.yml b/ci/conda_env_python.yml
index c187155275..d3756cbcfa 100644
--- a/ci/conda_env_python.yml
+++ b/ci/conda_env_python.yml
@@ -22,7 +22,6 @@ nomkl
 numpy
 pandas
 pytest
-python
 rsync
 setuptools
 setuptools_scm
diff --git a/ci/travis_install_toolchain.sh b/ci/travis_install_toolchain.sh
index 86ac56d043..82031e8fd3 100755
--- a/ci/travis_install_toolchain.sh
+++ b/ci/travis_install_toolchain.sh
@@ -31,7 +31,6 @@ if [ ! -e $CPP_TOOLCHAIN ]; then
         --file=$TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_cpp.yml \
         ${CONDA_LLVM} \
         ccache \
-        curl \
         ninja \
         nomkl \
         python=3.6
diff --git a/ci/travis_script_python.sh b/ci/travis_script_python.sh
index 6d96ebe2df..b8385c3834 100755
--- a/ci/travis_script_python.sh
+++ b/ci/travis_script_python.sh
@@ -32,9 +32,6 @@ PYARROW_PYTEST_FLAGS=" -r sxX --durations=15 --parquet"
 PYTHON_VERSION=$1
 CONDA_ENV_DIR=$TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/pyarrow-test-$PYTHON_VERSION
 
-conda create -y -q -p $CONDA_ENV_DIR python=$PYTHON_VERSION cmake curl
-conda activate $CONDA_ENV_DIR
-
 # We should use zlib in the target Python directory to avoid loading
 # wrong libpython on macOS at run-time. If we use zlib in
 # $ARROW_BUILD_TOOLCHAIN and libpython3.6m.dylib exists in both
@@ -44,19 +41,23 @@ conda activate $CONDA_ENV_DIR
 # python-test fails.
 export ZLIB_HOME=$CONDA_ENV_DIR
 
-python --version
-which python
-
 if [ $ARROW_TRAVIS_PYTHON_JVM == "1" ]; then
   CONDA_JVM_DEPS="jpype1"
 fi
 
-conda install -y -q \
+conda create -y -q -p $CONDA_ENV_DIR \
       --file $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
+      cmake \
       pip \
       numpy=1.13.1 \
+      python=${PYTHON_VERSION} \
       ${CONDA_JVM_DEPS}
 
+conda activate $CONDA_ENV_DIR
+
+python --version
+which python
+
 if [ "$ARROW_TRAVIS_PYTHON_DOCS" == "1" ] && [ "$PYTHON_VERSION" == "3.6" ]; then
   # Install documentation dependencies
   conda install -y -c conda-forge --file ci/conda_env_sphinx.yml

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I'm not sure when that started to happen, but you can see here and below:
https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/468438196#L2973

... that the Python 2.7 run on Travis-CI actually installs and tests with Python 3.6.

comments.body: Introduce 5 days ago in this [PR|https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/9da458437162574f3e0d82e4a51dc6c1589b9f94#diff-aee66b8f0a6985fc804d52208dce2397R55] .This is due to `python` being present in [conda_env_python.yml|https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/conda_env_python.yml#L25].
